trans-unit.source: Set up a Windows 10 device with Azure AD from Settings| Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Set up a Windows 10 device with Azure AD from Settings| Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: A topic that explains how users can join to Azure AD through the settings menu.
trans-unit.target: A topic that explains how users can join to Azure AD through the settings menu.

trans-unit.source: Set up a Windows 10 device with Azure AD from Settings
trans-unit.target: Set up a Windows 10 device with Azure AD from Settings

trans-unit.source: If you are already using Windows 7 or 8, and your machine is upgraded to Windows 10, you can join to Azure AD through the Settings menu.
trans-unit.target: If you are already using Windows 7 or 8, and your machine is upgraded to Windows 10, you can join to Azure AD through the Settings menu.

trans-unit.source: To join to Azure AD from the settings menu
trans-unit.target: To join to Azure AD from the settings menu

trans-unit.source: From the Start menu, click the Settings charm.
trans-unit.target: From the Start menu, click the Settings charm.

trans-unit.source: Click **Continue** on the Azure AD Join message window.
trans-unit.target: Click **Continue** on the Azure AD Join message window.

trans-unit.source: This sign in experience will include all steps required to complete authentication.
trans-unit.target: This sign in experience will include all steps required to complete authentication.

trans-unit.source: If you are part of a federated tenant, your administrator will provide you federation experience hosted by your organization.
trans-unit.target: If you are part of a federated tenant, your administrator will provide you federation experience hosted by your organization.

trans-unit.source: If your organization has configured multi-factor authenticaion for joining to Azure AD, you will have to provide the second factor before being able to proceed.
trans-unit.target: If your organization has configured multi-factor authenticaion for joining to Azure AD, you will have to provide the second factor before being able to proceed.

trans-unit.source: Click **Accept** on the Allow this device to be managed screen.
trans-unit.target: Click **Accept** on the Allow this device to be managed screen.

trans-unit.source: you should see the message "Your device is now joined to your organization in Azure AD".
trans-unit.target: you should see the message "Your device is now joined to your organization in Azure AD".

trans-unit.source: Extending cloud capabilities to Windows 10 devices through Azure Active Directory Join
trans-unit.target: Extending cloud capabilities to Windows 10 devices through Azure Active Directory Join

trans-unit.source: Learn about usage scenarios and deployment considerations for Azure AD Join
trans-unit.target: Learn about usage scenarios and deployment considerations for Azure AD Join
